results.title: All summer in a day
results.creator_credit: Karl Epstein, Learning Corporation of America and Ed Kaplan
results.brief_description: Based on a short story by Ray Bradbury, this short film is set on a planet where the sun shines for only a few minutes once every nine years. Margot, a frail loner, wistfully recalls her days on sunny Earth and waits longingly for the rare appearance of the sun. But she pays dearly for her sensitivity when, as a victim of teasing, she is locked in a closet for the duration of the event. The other children, overwhelmed by the sun’s warmth, have forgotten and left her there. By the time they release her it’s too late - the rain has begun to fall. This is a tale of the destructive nature of thoughtlessness and cruelty.

results.title: All star casting
results.creator_credit: Edward Cook and Big Six Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes the processes employed in a large British foundry. Begins in the pattern makers shop and then shows making of sand moulds. After pouring, the moulds are allowed to cool and then broken to remove castings. Moulding sand is collected for re-use. Shock blasting is employed to clean castings after which they are machined and annealed. Castings manufactured by the firm include parts for tractors, fork lifting trucks, cranes, excavators and internal combustion engines.

results.title: All set backstage
results.creator_credit: Prahran College of Advanced Education and Paul Cox
results.brief_description: The name of J.C. Williamson has long been associated with the theatre in Australia. In an early Paul Cox short film, he takes an historical look at J.C. Williamson and some of the famous acts they brought to Australia. Narrated by Lady Viola Tait.

results.title: All over the shop
results.creator_credit: J.D. Chambers, Data Film Productions, European Productivity Agency and Peter Pickering
results.brief_description: Shows examples of how Work Study has been applied in the reorganization of departments in three different firms. In the packing department of a large pharmaceutical works the flow of work was improved, the individual jobs made easier by the use of simple cheap apparatus made for the purpose. Unnecessary movement of personnel was eliminated in the making-up department of a hosiery firm by adoption of a new layout involving the use of conveyor belts. In the sheet metal shop of an electronic instrument firm, Work Study was used to relieve the shortage of skilled operatives.

results.title: All our tomorrows
results.creator_credit: Rosalind Farber, Rosalind Eduemon and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
This film examines an integrated community care program in Canada which allows older people to remain in the community as long as possible and lead full, happy and productive lives.

results.title: All our lives
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB and Sky Works Charitable Foundation
results.brief_description: All of Our Lives examines the reasons why many women face economic hardship and emotional isolation in old age. It is a film about past dreams and, for the most part, unexpected realities. Elderly women from a variety of backgrounds and circumstances recall their girlhood ideals, and contrast them with the experiences of their actual adult lives. The film challenges audiences to re-evaluate the undervalued and often “invisible” world of child-rearing and work in the home.

results.title: All our futures
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell Inc and Harold Mantell
results.brief_description: Narrated by Peter Ustinov this film shows the 25 years of service to children by UNICEF. Beginning in 12 European countries where five million children were given food, medicine and clothing during the emergency period after World War II, and then moving - over the years and to many different places - to show its diversified work in many more countries including Africa and Latin America.

results.title: All Of The Lights music video
All my own work (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows how new approaches in art education in Victoria can be successfully applied in the classroom. As the new course is child-centred, the film visualises some of the environmental influences that children experience
